answers.answer: Hi, symptoms can be caused by varying health disorders, Diabetes can cause the symptoms you have described, low blood sugar can cause one to feel dizzy, feel like passing out, Etc....Best to consult with your pcp, address your concerns to them, have them do tests necessary to alleviate your symptoms.  Have them for a thyroid panel, TSH, FT3/FT4, post results here, someone here will be able to assist.  Wishing you well :)

hi,it def could be your thyroid, i was feeling the same in nov. i fnally went to the doc in feb and was diagnosed with hypothyroid after getting blood results back. TSH was 242, free t4 was absent and free t3 was 25.when u get results back, basically a high tsh and low t4 n t3 indicates hypo.

question: Lately I've been feeling sick during and after I eat. I also get these dizzy spells where the room feels like it's spinnng and I get blurred vision/black dotts. I don't faint or blackout or anything though. My feet have been sweeling and I have a HUGE craving for salt. My family has a history or Thyroid Disorders. Could these symptons have anything to do with that? All this is quite scary. Thanks in advance for any help.
title: I'm not really sure whats going on...?
